title: Highest rainfall in past 24 hours recorded in Nillambe, Kandy
byline: According to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC), the highest rainfall recorded during the past 24 hours has been reported from Nillambe in Kandy, with rainfall levels recording 431 mm.

title: Latest on Cyclone “Ditwah”
byline: The Cyclonic Storm “Ditwah” is currently centered near latitude 8.8°N and longitude 80.8°E, about 60km West-northwest of Trincomalee, according to the update issued by the Department of Meteorology at 2:00 a.m. today.

title: Cyclone “Ditwah”: Red alert issued for Tamil Nadu coastal districts
byline: Cyclone “Ditwah” is gradually moving away from Sri Lanka towards the Bay of Bengal region and Tamil Nadu, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has stated.

title: Special circular issued to all health workers amidst prevailing disaster situation
byline: The Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Mass Media have declared a state of emergency within the health sector for one week until December 4 in order to ensure uninterrupted health services to the public.

title: Water supply affected to several areas owing to submerged plants
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) says several of its water sources and purification plants have been submerged due to the prevailing flood situation.

title: Prevailing rainy conditions will considerably reduce by tomorrow – Met. Department
byline: The prevailing rainy weather conditions will reduce considerably by tomorrow (30), the Department of Meteorology has announced.

title: Death toll due to Cyclone Ditwah climbs further
byline: The death toll reported so far from Badulla and Kandy due to the severe weather affecting the country has risen to 85, according to data from the Disaster Management Centre and respective district secretaries.

title: Operations at Colombo Port temporarily suspended
byline: Operations at the Colombo Port have been temporarily suspended.

title: Train services on main line suspended due to bad weather
byline: The railway authorities have announced that trains scheduled to operate on the Main Line this morning will be suspended due to flooding affecting several sections of the track, including Daraluwa and Gampaha.

title: Directive issued for all prison officers amid disaster situation
byline: The Commissioner General of Prisons has instructed prison officers who are unable to reach their designated workplaces due to the ongoing disaster situation in the country to report immediately to the nearest prison.

title: At least 40 rescued from bus stranded on Kalawewa Bridge
byline: Security forces personnel have successfully rescued at least 40 people, including a foreign woman, who had climbed onto the rooftop of a nearby residence after the bus they were travelling in was trapped by floodwaters on the Kalawewa Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road.

title: Water levels rise in Attanagalu Oya; Flood risk persists in Gampaha District
byline: The Irrigation Department has reported that the water level of the Attanagalu Oya in the Gampaha District continues to rise.

title: Landslide strikes near Kotmale; Dozens trapped
byline: A landslide has reportedly occurred near Rambadagama in Kotmale, affecting the middle section of the village between the Nuwara Eliya–Pudalu Oya roads.

title: High-risk flood situation in low-lying areas of Maha Oya within next 24 hours
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a high-risk flood warning for the low-lying areas of the Maha Oya Basin for the next 24 hours.

title: Indian aircraft with 12 tons of humanitarian aid arrives in BIA
byline: An Indian aircraft carrying approximately 12 tons of humanitarian aid arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this morning (29), the External Affairs Minister of India, Dr. S. Jaishankar, announced.

title: President monitors live rescue of bus stranded on Kalawewa Bridge
byline: The individuals who were stranded in a bus after it was struck by floodwaters on the Kalawewa Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road are currently sheltering on the roof of a nearby residence.

title: Death toll due to Cyclone Ditwah increases to 123, another 130 missing
byline: The number of deaths reported owing to adverse weather conditions across the country in the past few days has increased to 123, the Disaster Management Centre noted.

title: Indian rescue team arrives to assist flood victims in Sri Lanka
byline: An Indian rescue team arrived in Sri Lanka this morning (29) to support ongoing relief efforts following severe weather conditions in the country.

title: Major landslide strikes Welimada; Two bodies recovered
byline: A major landslide has occurred near Keppetipola Police Station in Welimada, resulting in the closure of the Welimada–Nuwara Eliya road.

title: Cyclone Ditwah heads towards Tamil Nadu as fresh alerts issued, flights cancelled
byline: With Cyclone Ditwah steadily advancing towards the north Tamil Nadu and Puducherry coasts, Indian authorities have stepped up preparedness on multiple fronts, from large-scale relief operations to flight cancellations and district-wide holiday notifications for schools and colleges.

title: IGP Special Operations Unit launched to provide updates on emergency disaster situation
byline: The Police Media Division has reported that due to unexpected severe weather conditions affecting the island, several areas have experienced heavy rainfall, flooding, strong winds, and landslides. Evacuation notices have been issued to residents in multiple affected regions.

title: All passengers rescued from flood-stranded bus on Kala Oya Bridge
byline: Security forces personnel have successfully rescued all 67 passengers, including a foreign woman, who had climbed onto the rooftop of a nearby residence after the bus they were travelling in was trapped by floodwaters on the Kala Oya Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road, the Sri Lanka Navy Spokesman confirmed.

title: All 33 persons trapped in Giribawa rescued by SLAF helicopter
byline: All 33 individuals who were trapped in the Giribawa area of Rajanganaya have been successfully rescued by a Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) Mi-17 helicopter, the Air Force announced.

title: Special visa measures for foreigners affected by adverse weather in Sri Lanka
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has announced special visa facilitation measures for foreign nationals impacted by the ongoing adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: High-risk flood situation in lower Mahaweli River basin; residents urged to evacuate
byline: The Irrigation Department reports that, due to the heavy rainfall received in the Mahaweli River catchment areas and current water level readings at the Manampitiya gauging station, the major flood situation in low-lying areas of the lower Mahaweli River basin is expected to escalate to a critical flood level.

title: Warning issued over possible disruption to Colombo water supply
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that the operations of the Ambatale Water Treatment Plant may be affected due to the rising water level of the Kelani River.

title: Landslide reported in Ankumbura; many persons reported missing
byline: A landslide has occurred in the Ankumbura area, within the Alawathugoda Police Division, as a result of the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Sri Lanka declares State of Public Emergency
byline: The President of Sri Lanka, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, has issued an Extraordinary Gazette declaring a State of Public Emergency across the country.

title: “Manusath Derana” flood relief programme continues for second day
byline: The Manusath Derana “Flood Relief” programme, launched to support those affected by the prevailing adverse weather, continues for the second consecutive day today (29).

title: RDA workers caught in accident while clearing earth mound
byline: A group of Road Development Authority (RDA) workers, who had been dispatched to remove an earth mound that had collapsed onto the Welimada–Nuwara Eliya main road in the Gawarammana area, met with an accident during the operation.

title: Met. Department warns of continued indirect effects following Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Director General of the Department of Meteorology, Athula Karunanayake, stated that although the direct effects of the cyclone have subsided as it has moved away from the island, the indirect effects will continue.

title: 03 women trapped at Malwathu Oya Railway Bridge rescued by SLAF helicopter
byline: Three women who were trapped at the Malwathu Oya Railway Bridge in Anuradhapura have been safely rescued through an air operation.

title: Closure of Muslim schools extended amid severe weather
byline: The Ministry of Education has announced that the closure of all Muslim schools, which had been in effect since November 27 due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions across the island, has been extended until December 05.

title: At least 40 rescued from bus stranded on Kala Oya Bridge
byline: Security forces personnel have successfully rescued at least 40 people, including a foreign woman, who had climbed onto the rooftop of a nearby residence after the bus they were travelling in was trapped by floodwaters on the Kala Oya Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road.

title: 132 dead and 171 missing amid severe weather in Sri Lanka
byline: According to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC), a total of 132 deaths have been reported so far, while 171 individuals remain missing due to the ongoing adverse weather conditions affecting the country.

title: At least 21 missing following landslide in Thulhiriya
byline: At least 21 persons have been reported missing following a landslide in the Monroviyawatte area of Thulhiriya in Warakapola, the police confirmed.

title: President monitors live rescue of bus stranded on Kala Oya Bridge
byline: The individuals who were stranded in a bus after it was struck by floodwaters on the Kala Oya Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road are currently sheltering on the roof of a nearby residence.

title: SriLankan Airlines advises all crew to contact Control Centre amid prevailing situation
byline: SriLankan Airlines has announced that, due to the prevailing adverse weather situation in the country, communication disruptions have hindered contact with a number of pilots and cabin crew members.

title: US pledges $2 million to support Sri Lanka flood relief efforts
byline: The United States has pledged $2 million to assist urgent relief efforts in Sri Lanka, following the severe impact of Cyclone Ditwah, which has caused heavy rains and flooding across many areas.

title: Two toll-free hotlines to report about women and children in distress
byline: Two toll-free telephone numbers have been made available for the public to report information and seek assistance for women and children in distress, the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs announced.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Heavy rains lash Tamil Nadu; flight, train services disrupted
byline: Heavy rainfall lashed parts of Tamil Nadu on Saturday, with Cyclone Ditwah inching towards the southern state.

title: Three landslides reported in Kurunegala; 9 dead, 24 missing
byline: Kurunegala District has been severely affected by landslides in three locations, resulting in 9 deaths and 24 people reported missing, authorities confirmed.

title: Hong Kong mourns victims of fire that killed 128 and counting
byline: Hong Kong’s leaders oversaw a ceremony on Saturday to mourn the at least 128 people killed in a high-rise apartment complex fire, a toll that is likely to rise further with 200 others still unaccounted for days after the tragedy.

title: Australian prime minister becomes first to wed in office
byline: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has married his partner Jodie Haydon, becoming the country’s first leader to marry while in office.

title: Access roads to Nuwara Eliya and Anuradhapura cities obstructed
byline: Road Development Authority (RDA) Director General Wimal Kandambi stated that many roads and bridges across the country have been severely damaged due to floods and landslides caused by the prevailing adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka.

title: 11 dead, 14 rescued after elderly home flooded in Pannala
byline: According to police, a total of 11 residents of an elderly home in Nalawalana, Pannala Police Division, have died due to flooding caused by the ongoing severe weather.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather rises to 153
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) reports that the death toll thus far resulting from the recent adverse weather conditions has risen to 153.

title: Govt launches special operation to restore damaged communication networks amid disaster situation
byline: A discussion was held today (29) at the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) between the Government and leading telecommunication companies.

title: Japan to dispatch assessment team and emergency aid to Sri Lanka
byline: The Government of Japan has announced that it will dispatch an assessment team to Sri Lanka through the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), following the massive damage caused by the cyclone ‘Ditwah.’

title: Indonesia flood death toll climbs to 303 amid cyclone devastation, disaster agency says
byline: The death toll from floods and landslides following cyclonic rains in the Indonesian island of Sumatra has risen to 303, the head of the country’s disaster mitigation agency said on Saturday, up from a previous figure of 174 dead.

title: Death toll owing to adverse weather climbs to 159 with over 203 missing
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports that 159 deaths have been recorded so far as adverse weather conditions continue to affect the island.
